SystemSettingsProxy * mpProxy

Detailed Description

The SystemSettings provider contains global system-level device preferences.

The following example demonstrates how to use the SystemSettings

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {
     // new Context instance
     Context* context = new Context(this);

     // new SystemSettings
     SystemSettings *setting = new SystemSettings(*context);

     //get int value
     int32_t musicVolume = setting->getInt(SystemSettings::VOLUME_MUSIC, 0);

     //Set String value
     setting->setString(SystemSettings::UNLOCK_SOUND, "/system/media/audio/ui/Unlock.ogg");

     //Set int value
     setting->setInt(SystemSettings::SCREEN_OFF_TIMEOUT, 100000);

     delete setting;
     delete context;
 }
See also:
SecureSettings

Definition at line 50 of file SystemSettings.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::content::SystemSettings::SystemSettingsItem

System settings items, define how many settings items in SystemSettings.

Enumerator:
STAY_ON_WHILE_PLUGGED_IN 

Whether we keep the device on while the device is plugged in.

Supported values are: 0 to never stay on while plugged in 1 to stay on for AC charger 2 to stay on for USB charger These values can be OR-ed together.

END_BUTTON_BEHAVIOR 

What happens when the user presses the end call button if they're not on a call.

Values: 0 - The end button does nothing. 1 - The end button goes to the home screen. 2 - The end button puts the device to sleep and locks the keyguard. 3 - The end button goes to the home screen. If the user is already on the home screen, it puts the device to sleep.

AIRPLANE_MODE_ON 

Whether Airplane Mode is on.

RADIO_BLUETOOTH 

Constant for use in AIRPLANE_MODE_RADIOS to specify Bluetooth radio.

RADIO_WIFI 

Constant for use in AIRPLANE_MODE_RADIOS to specify Wi-Fi radio.

RADIO_CELL 

Constant for use in AIRPLANE_MODE_RADIOS to specify Cellular radio.

AIRPLANE_MODE_RADIOS 

A comma separated list of radios that need to be disabled when airplane mode is on.

This overrides WIFI_ON and BLUETOOTH_ON, if Wi-Fi and bluetooth are included in the comma separated list.

AIRPLANE_MODE_TOGGLEABLE_RADIOS 

A comma separated list of radios that should to be disabled when airplane mode is on, but can be manually reenabled by the user.

For example, if RADIO_WIFI is added to both AIRPLANE_MODE_RADIOS and AIRPLANE_MODE_TOGGLEABLE_RADIOS, then Wifi will be turned off when entering airplane mode, but the user will be able to reenable Wifi in the Settings app.

WIFI_SLEEP_POLICY 

The policy for deciding when Wi-Fi should go to sleep (which will in turn switch to using the mobile data as an Internet connection).

Set to one of WIFI_SLEEP_POLICY_DEFAULT, WIFI_SLEEP_POLICY_NEVER_WHILE_PLUGGED, or WIFI_SLEEP_POLICY_NEVER.

WIFI_USE_STATIC_IP 

Whether to use static IP and other static network attributes.

Set to 1 for true and 0 for false.

WIFI_STATIC_IP 

The static IP address.

Example: "192.168.0.1"

WIFI_STATIC_GATEWAY 

If using static IP, the gateway's IP address.

Example: "192.168.1.1"

WIFI_STATIC_NETMASK 

If using static IP, the net mask.

Example: "255.255.255.0"

WIFI_STATIC_DNS1 

If using static IP, the primary DNS's IP address.

Example: "192.168.1.1"

WIFI_STATIC_DNS2 

If using static IP, the secondary DNS's IP address.

Example: "192.168.1.2"

BLUETOOTH_DISCOVERABILITY 

Determines whether remote devices may discover and/or connect to this device.

Type: INT 2 -- discoverable and connectable 1 -- connectable but not discoverable 0 -- neither connectable nor discoverable

BLUETOOTH_DISCOVERABILITY_TIMEOUT 

Bluetooth discoverability timeout.

If this value is nonzero, then Bluetooth becomes discoverable for a certain number of seconds, after which is becomes simply connectable. The value is in seconds.

NEXT_ALARM_FORMATTED 

A formatted string of the next alarm that is set, or the empty string if there is no alarm set.

FONT_SCALE 

Scaling factor for fonts, float.

DEBUG_APP 

Name of an application package to be debugged.

WAIT_FOR_DEBUGGER 

If 1, when launching DEBUG_APP it will wait for the debugger before starting user code.

If 0, it will run normally.

DIM_SCREEN 

Whether or not to dim the screen.

0=no 1=yes

SCREEN_OFF_TIMEOUT 

The timeout before the screen turns off.

SCREEN_BRIGHTNESS 

The screen backlight brightness between 0 and 255.

SCREEN_BRIGHTNESS_MODE 

Control whether to enable automatic brightness mode.

manual mode = 0 automatic mode = 1

SHOW_PROCESSES 

Control whether the process CPU usage meter should be shown.

ALWAYS_FINISH_ACTIVITIES 

If 1, the activity manager will aggressively finish activities and processes as soon as they are no longer needed.

If 0, the normal extended lifetime is used.

MODE_RINGER 

Ringer mode.

This is used internally, changing this value will not change the ringer mode. .

MODE_RINGER_STREAMS_AFFECTED 

Determines which streams are affected by ringer mode changes.

The stream type's bit should be set to 1 if it should be muted when going into an inaudible ringer mode.

MUTE_STREAMS_AFFECTED 

Determines which streams are affected by mute.

The stream type's bit should be set to 1 if it should be muted when a mute request is received.

VIBRATE_ON 

Whether vibrate is on for different events.

This is used internally, changing this value will not change the vibrate. .

VOLUME_RING 

Ringer volume.

This is used internally, changing this value will not change the volume. .

VOLUME_SYSTEM 

System/notifications volume.

This is used internally, changing this value will not change the volume. .

VOLUME_VOICE 

Voice call volume.

This is used internally, changing this value will not change the volume.

VOLUME_MUSIC 

Music/media/gaming volume.

This is used internally, changing this value will not change the volume. .

VOLUME_ALARM 

Alarm volume.

This is used internally, changing this value will not change the volume. .

VOLUME_NOTIFICATION 

Notification volume.

This is used internally, changing this value will not change the volume. .

VOLUME_BLUETOOTH_SCO 

Bluetooth Headset volume.

This is used internally, changing this value will not change the volume. .

NOTIFICATIONS_USE_RING_VOLUME 

Whether the notifications should use the ring volume (value of 1) or a separate notification volume (value of 0).

In most cases, users will have this enabled so the notification and ringer volumes will be the same. However, power users can disable this and use the separate notification volume control.

Note: This is a one-off setting that will be removed in the future when there is profile support. For this reason, it is kept hidden from the APIs.

VIBRATE_IN_SILENT 

Whether silent mode should allow vibration feedback.

This is used internally in AudioService and the Sound settings Page to coordinate decoupling of vibrate and silent modes. This setting will likely be removed in a future release with support for audio/vibe feedback profiles.

APPEND_FOR_LAST_AUDIBLE 

Appended to various volume related settings to record the previous values before they the settings were affected by a silent/vibrate ringer mode change.

RINGTONE 

Persistent store for the system-wide default ringtone URI.

NOTIFICATION_SOUND 

Persistent store for the system-wide default notification sound.

See also:
RINGTONE
ALARM_ALERT 

Persistent store for the system-wide default alarm alert.

See also:
RINGTONE
TEXT_AUTO_REPLACE 

Setting to enable Auto Replace (AutoText) in text editors.

1 = On, 0 = Off

TEXT_AUTO_CAPS 

Setting to enable Auto Caps in text editors.

1 = On, 0 = Off

TEXT_AUTO_PUNCTUATE 

Setting to enable Auto Punctuate in text editors.

1 = On, 0 = Off. This feature converts two spaces to a "." and space.

TEXT_SHOW_PASSWORD 

Setting to showing password characters in text editors.

1 = On, 0 = Off

AUTO_TIME 

Value to specify if the user prefers the date, time and time zone to be automatically fetched from the network (NITZ).

1=yes, 0=no

TIME_12_24 

Display times as 12 or 24 hours 12 24.

DATE_FORMAT 

Date format string mm/dd/yyyy dd/mm/yyyy yyyy/mm/dd.

SETUP_WIZARD_HAS_RUN 

Whether the setup wizard has been run before (on first boot), or if it still needs to be run.

nonzero = it has been run in the past 0 = it has not been run in the past

WINDOW_ANIMATION_SCALE 

Scaling factor for normal window animations.

Setting to 0 will disable window animations.

TRANSITION_ANIMATION_SCALE 

Scaling factor for Page transition animations.

Setting to 0 will disable window animations.

FANCY_IME_ANIMATIONS 

Scaling factor for normal window animations.

Setting to 0 will disable window animations.

ACCELEROMETER_ROTATION 

Control whether the accelerometer will be used to change screen orientation.

If 0, it will not be used unless explicitly requested by the application; if 1, it will be used by default unless explicitly disabled by the application.

DTMF_TONE_WHEN_DIALING 

Whether the audible DTMF tones are played by the dialer when dialing.

The value is boolean (1 or 0).

DTMF_TONE_TYPE_WHEN_DIALING 

CDMA only settings DTMF tone type played by the dialer when dialing.

0 = Normal 1 = Long

EMERGENCY_TONE 

CDMA only settings, Emergency Tone 0 = Off 1 = Alert 2 = Vibrate.

CALL_AUTO_RETRY 

CDMA only settings Whether the auto retry is enabled.

The value is boolean (1 or 0).

HEARING_AID 

Whether the hearing aid is enabled.

The value is boolean (1 or 0).

TTY_MODE 

CDMA only settings TTY Mode 0 = OFF 1 = FULL 2 = VCO 3 = HCO.

SOUND_EFFECTS_ENABLED 

Whether the sounds effects (key clicks, lid open ...) are enabled.

The value is boolean (1 or 0).

HAPTIC_FEEDBACK_ENABLED 

Whether the haptic feedback (long presses, ...) are enabled.

The value is boolean (1 or 0).

NOTIFICATION_LIGHT_PULSE 

Whether the notification LED should repeatedly flash when a notification is pending.

The value is boolean (1 or 0).

POINTER_LOCATION 

Show pointer location on screen? 0 = no 1 = yes.

POWER_SOUNDS_ENABLED 

Whether to play a sound for low-battery alerts.

DOCK_SOUNDS_ENABLED 

Whether to play a sound for dock events.

LOCKSCREEN_SOUNDS_ENABLED 

Whether to play sounds when the keyguard is shown and dismissed.

LOW_BATTERY_SOUND 

URI for the low battery sound file.

DESK_DOCK_SOUND 

URI for the desk dock "in" event sound.

DESK_UNDOCK_SOUND 

URI for the desk dock "out" event sound.

CAR_DOCK_SOUND 

URI for the car dock "in" event sound.

CAR_UNDOCK_SOUND 

URI for the car dock "out" event sound.

LOCK_SOUND 

URI for the "device locked" (keyguard shown) sound.

UNLOCK_SOUND 

URI for the "device unlocked" (keyguard dismissed) sound.

AUTO_TIME_ZONE 

Value to specify if the user prefers the time zone to be automatically fetched from the network (NITZ).

1=yes, 0=no

QUICK_SETTINGS_LIST 

for quicksettings.

TWO_FINGER_SCREENSHOT_KEY 

for 2-Finger screenshot

PREFIX_APP_STORAGE_LOCATION 

Application storage location settings The prefix string of application database key.

APP_STORAGE_LOCATION_PHONE_STORAGE 

Application storage location settings The constant value of application storage location settings: indicate using phone storage.

APP_STORAGE_LOCATION_SD_CARD_STORAGE 

Application storage location settings The constant value of application storage location settings: indicate using SD card storage.

MAGNIFIER_SETTING_ENABLED 

Whether magnifier is enable or not.

USAGELOG_REPORT_ON 

Set usage log report on/off.

for error report.

ERROR_REPORT_NETWORK_PREFERENCE 

Set error report network preference.

for error report.

ERROR_REPORT_AUTO_REPORT_ON 

Set error report auto report on/off.

for error report.

SILENT_MODE 

Set silent mode on/off.

BE_POLITE 

Set be polite on/off.

POCKET_MODE 

Set pocket mode on/off.

BLUETOOTH_NAME 

bluetooth name.

SMARTSYNC_SLEEPMODE_START_TIME 

smart sync sleep mode start time.

SMARTSYNC_SLEEPMODE_END_TIME 

smart sync slee mode end time.

CLOUD_BACKUP_KEY 

cloud backup key.

CLOUD_RESTORE_KEY 

cloud restore key.

OPENNETWORK_BLOCKED_LIST_ARRAY 

open network blocked list array.

HOTSPOT_HIDDEN 

hotspot hidden.

DOCK_HOTSPOT_ON 

dock hotspot on.

DOCK_WIFI_ON 

dock wifi on.

WIRELESS_SLEEP_MODE_ENABLED 

wireless sleep mode enabled.

WIRELESS_SLEEP_START_TIME 

wireless sleep start time.

WIRELESS_SLEEP_END_TIME 

wireless sleep end time.

HOTSPOT_POWER_MODE_REMIND_DIALOG 

hotspot power mode remind dialog.

STRICT_MODE 

set strict mode enable.

SHOW_TOUCHES 

Show touch positions on screen? 0 = no 1 = yes .

ANIMATION_ENABLED 

set animation enable.

ANIMATOR_DURATION_SCALE 

Scaling factor for Animator-based animations.

This affects both the start delay and duration of all such animations. Setting to 0 will cause animations to end immediately. The default value is 1.

HOME_SWIPE 

set home swipe enable.

HOME_LONGPRESSED_KEY 

set home longpressed key.

HIDE_NAV_BAR 

set hide nav bar.

BUTTON_DOUBLE_CLICK_SPEED 

set double click speed.

CALENDAR_START_WEEKDAY 

set start weekday.

Definition at line 79 of file SystemSettings.h.

enum gaia::content::SystemSettings::WifiSleepPolicyValues

Values for WIFI_SLEEP_POLICY.

Enumerator:
WIFI_SLEEP_POLICY_DEFAULT 

Value for WIFI_SLEEP_POLICY to use the default Wi-Fi sleep policy, which is to sleep shortly after the turning off according to the STAY_ON_WHILE_PLUGGED_IN setting.

WIFI_SLEEP_POLICY_NEVER_WHILE_PLUGGED 

Value for WIFI_SLEEP_POLICY to use the default policy when the device is on battery, and never go to sleep when the device is plugged in.

WIFI_SLEEP_POLICY_NEVER 

Value for WIFI_SLEEP_POLICY to never go to sleep.

Definition at line 807 of file SystemSettings.h.

valueThe new value for the setting.
Returns:
true if the value was set, false on setting fail.
